text:
APPEARANCE- cloudy, super bright color and clearly unfiltered. Golden straw color. Head is pure white as the drive snow and has large bubbles. (I dont know what drives large vs small bubbles.)
NOSE- lightly resinous, and hints of tropical fruitiness. 
FLAVOR- lightly bodied, light hop flavor and light malt backbone to build on. 
NOTES-thoroughly drinkable! Great for a medium-hot Saturday afternoon in MA. Lighter beer than I expected from a brewery from the great white North, but it is an excellent brew and perfect for today. Well deserving of 100.

Sample at Bobs Bar during the Taste of the Coast with Maine Beer Company event on 05/17/2017. The beer pours a hazy golden color with a medium fluffy white head that diminishes gradually to a film. Strings of lacing on the glass. Aroma of tropical fruit, hops and malt. Medium body with flavors of grapefruit, piney hops and malt. The finish is moderately bitter with a fruity hop aftertaste. Solid IPA all around.

Hazy yellowish tonality, thick white head.lemony syrup and citrus with a floral bite. Light and crisp initially with soft underlying notes of melon and hops.crisp smooth finish

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Pours a hazy light yellow amber from a tap. Big piney aroma with a nice citrus note, flavor settles in to a mixed citrus juice with tangerine and a hint of grapefruit, lots of resin but very well balanced. Doesn't hit you over the head but also not subtle with its hoppiness. Pretty good beer.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle: Poured a pale yellow color ale with a large pure white foamy head with good retention and some lacing. Aroma of floral grassy hops notes with light citrusy notes is quite pleasant. Taste is a great mix of citrusy hops notes with some grassy/green notes with light residuals sugar notes and minimal bitterness. Body is about average with good carbonation. Another super IPA from a great brewery.
Tap at Sedona. Citrus and light grass nose. Flavor is smooth citrus peel, including lemon. Grasses in there too. Kinda bland. Not a ton of flavor but not bad. Hint of black pepper in the end.

Ah, "another" great "one" from Maine Beer Company. Pours a light golden color, and the aroma is bright, citrusy, and a bit piney... like a spring field. The taste has pine and citrus and hops too-- with some lemon and resiny and almost funky quality to it. Devilishly drinkable. Great for picking up on the way to the best shwarma place in town on a crisp spring Friday night with your booboo.

500ml bottle. Dated march 23rd. Pours pale yellow slightly hazy. Big white foamy head. Lots lacing. Amazing look. Soft carbonation. Nose sharp floral and citrusy notes. Taste quite malty with floral and piny hops. Very smooth. Spicy finish. Slightly resinous. Another awesome beer by those guys.

Pours a golden yellow citrus aroma. Good body with hints of pineapple. Smooth with a hoppy back end

John L - Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Draught. Pours cloudy straw yellow with a medium white head. Aroma is floral hops, mango, pineapple, papaya, and grass. Taste is dough, mango, orange, pineapple, and light resinous pine. Moderately bitter. Medium body. Moderate carbonation. Creamy mouthfeel.

The aroma is a moderate resin with a hint of citrus. The body is a hazy golden color and topped with a resilient foamy white head. The head clings to glass in rings with each sampling. It has a moderate bitter tone. The resin and tropical citrus comes through on your taste buds also. It finishes on clean and dry side. It has refreshing and friendly quality. One of the better IPAs Ive ever had.

Refreshing but still bold, balanced and deceivingly easy. Great combination of citrus and sweet fruits.

Bottle, shared at a tasting in Tokyo on 1/8/17. Bottled 10/18/16. Hazy yellow color. White head, dense but also frothy. Aromas of resin, citrus, pineapple. Retronasal its citrussy sour. Flavor is moderate bitter with citrussy sourness. Medium bodied. Finishes rather bitter, resinous, sourish. Delicious.

Draft to taster at Cappys pour light straw gold with moderate white head. Nose grass, tropical fruit, resin. Taste moderate bitter up front, then nice flavoring hop ,grassy, some juicy fruit flavors. Light bitter finish.

very light and hazy in color with huge long lasting head. light citrus hops, faint tropical fruits aromas. taste is hop forward but not overwhelming at all. hop side is multi-faceted, however malt side is very one note.

On tap @ Black Birch. Slightly hazed golden beer with a white head. Sweet orange and tropical fruits on the nose. Some orange, pineapple, and a touch of mango. Nice balance of some pine and citrus rind bitterness. A hint of watermelon to it, too. Pretty crisp beer, actually. Sort of a dry and semi-bitter finish. Pretty nice.

Tap at Snallyghaster 2016 showing well filtered neon yellow with a finger of clean white foam. 

The nose shows intense tropical and citrus fruit with light notes of cannabis. 

The palate is light and refreshing with smooth carbonation. A lot of juicy and clean pineapple and pine with a barely noticeable bitterness on the finish. Practically perfect.

Pour is a clean golden yellow with a light haze and foamy white head with nice lacing. Aroma is full of tropical fruit. Pine resin and citrus follow. Taste is mango, grapefruit, pineapple, orange, honey, and caramel. Very juicy and quenching with a semi dry finish. Outstanding.

On tap @ Doc Ponds. Pours hazy golden yellow with thick fluffy white head that laces well. Aroma is sweet fresh lemony citrus hops, no malt to speak of. Taste is light boozy pale malt, loads of fresh hops with notes of lemon rind, lime, and mango. Very light bitterness on the finish. Super juicy and delicious, great hop flavor.

On tap at SLL tasting. Pours super hazy golden yellow with a dense creamy white foam head. Smells like big pineapple, passionfruit, musty guava, some mango, orange and grapefruit citrus, mild biscuity cracker malt, with dank earthy grass and pine. Tastes like fresh passionfruit, pineapple, guava, underripe mango, orange and grapefruit citrus rind, some grainy biscuit malt, with fresh pine and dank earthy grass. Feels thick, medium bodied, creamy with moderate low carbonation.

22 oz bottle. Pours golden with tall, long lasting, fluffy white head, nice lacing and lively carbonation. Aroma is of citrusy hops, tropical fruit and bready malt. Body is medium and slightly crisp. Citrusy hops, bready malt and ripe fruit fill the mouth. Finish is long, dry. Another great brew from MB.
Bottle: pours a light hazy amber with a foamy white head, aroma is hoppy and grainy, taste is very hoppy, the hops linger on the tongue with a dry finish

Fresh ass bottle. Yellow pour with a white head. Citrus hop aromas. Taste follows suit. Taste follows suit with a prickly carbonation. Interesting. Good balance with plenty of malt backbeats. The body and mouthfeel are good. Its not overly bitter but that unique carbonation sets it apart.

[8141-20160415] Tap. Light grassy grains and citrus aroma. Slightly hazy, pale orange body with a quick foamy white head. Bitter light citrus grains flavour. Medium body. Good. (7/3/8/4/15) 3.7
(@ Coles, Buffalo, NY)

Bottle on 6.4.16. Pours a hazy straw. Fluffy white head. Nose is awesome citrus and clove. Taste is the same. Super clean, fresh, and refreshing. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Tap at the brewery with commonshawn, rosskyle, and samadouche. 5 oz pour. Very light golden color with a slight haze. Decent lacing. Aroma has great lemon charcteristics and an earthy almost, grassy note. Taste is super clean and nearly perfectly balanced. Great citrus and tropical fruit qualities. Bright and refreshing. Extremely easy to drink. This is how an IPA should taste. Hard to even put words down to describe. Just try this one.

Tap at brewery with commonmac and rosskyle and samadouche. Very light hazy gold with white head. Clean citrus hop nose. Very crisp. Taste is tropical fruit hop, extremely smooth, and perfectly balanced. Dry bitter spice finish, almost saison like. Thin clean body, crisp. Excellent.

Lighter than the pale, a hazy golden yellow. Fantastic citrus, floral tropical aroma and flavor. Perfectly moderately bitter. One of the better iPas Ive had in a while. Tap at Churchkey, DC. If they werent charging a buck an ounce, Ive have gotten more.

Pours light straw yellow with a one finger white head with good lacing. Aroma is of freshly squeezed citrus, juicy tropical fruits, melon, grass, white grapes, garlic, some dankness, and some light cracker malts. Taste is very similar to the aroma with a lot of tropical fruits, green notes, and fresh citrus flavors. Has a medium body with a creamy, soft mouthfeel and a semi dry, moderately bitter, long finish. Overall, a fantastic, world class IPA that reminds me a lot of Alpines Nelson minus the rye.

Light yellow color, almost opaque, with no head and thin oily lacing. Aroma is huge, tropical fruit, citrus and pineapple. Flavor is intense with rich balance of piney hoos and tropical fruit, half sweet and half bitter. Tastes like a beer mimosa. Sticky mouthfeel with fizzy tickling carbonation. Expensive $9.50 pint, but Very good!

UPDATED: JUL 4, 2016 2016-04-15. Lightly hazy yellow-orange body with a modest beige head. 3+ Aroma is pleasantly hoppy. Nice fruit character, melon and mango notes. 7++ Flavour is similarly fruity and happy, melon and mango with more of a green quality to it than in the aroma. Moderate bitterness throughout lingers in the finish. Smooth average bodied palate, moderate carbonation suits the beer. 3+ Tasty stuff. 8/3/7-8/3/16-17 On tap at 

Coles, Buffalo.
Solid IPA with fragrant hop notes swirling above a cloudy straw body and pillowy head.

bottle picked up from the tap house. pours mild amber orange, thin off white head. decent citrus nose. Taste follows. As it warms the tropical fruits are more present and accounted for. light to medium body with a slight dry finish.

Bottle. Pours mostly clear straw yellow. Aroma is white wine, floral notes, faint citrus, pale malt, and light pineapple. Flavor is is crisp and hoppy with really nice tropical/citrus notes and some white grape and a nice bitter finish. Medium body.

Not a fan of the light yellow / straw color, but the thin white head is sticky an laces up nicely. Aroma is phenomenal - citrus and tropical fruit with a hint of malt. Flavor is really nice - not a hop bomb - with a delicate bitterness thats very flavorful, again with the tropical fruits, and some resin that magically doesnt wreck the palette. Finish is fairly clean, slightly bitter. Hope I can try again on a hot summer day.
Pours a hazy yellow color with a foamy white head. Notes of candied lemons, white grapefruit, and general citrus. Well balanced and really good.
Tap. Cloudy light gold. Citrus and melon rind in the aroma with some crackery sweetness. Flavor is the same. Punchy and find. Light body

Draught at Fools Gold, NYC. Hazy pale golden beer with a nice offwhite head. Hoppy pine and citrus aroma, peach, orange zest, tangerines, some passion fruit. Hoppy pine flavor, passion fruit, peach, caramel notes, some orange zest. Hugely drinkable IPA.

Poured from draft at Grill Next Door thin light gold straw color with minimal white head. Aromas of fresh mango floral tones and pine. Taste is balanced and sweet with nice juicy citrus caramel and bready malt. Another win.

A well-balanced and well made IPA. Mangos were front and centre in the nose and the taste, with orange, punchy pineapple and apricot adding to a nice mix. A nice touch of soapiness adds to the complexity. Bready sweet malt sets this beer up well for success.
Draft. Exactly what youd expect from Maine: A really solid IPA with lots of depth. Theres some dank here, but theres also some bright pineapple tartness. Really nice.

On tap at rozis. Pours very light golden with thin white head. Aroma is grassy, piney and dank. Flavor is very crisp and bright hops with no malt to drown them out. Some citrus and some light onion. Flavors I love in a beer but a bit over- rated. Finishes more like a 5% session ipa. I have had better but still a very good regular IPA.

16 oz draft. Pours a slightly hazy gold with a think soapy white head. Aroma is banana, lemony citrus, and straw, bit of floral aroma. Body is light, mouthfeel silky, quite juicy. Well balanced between light piney bitterness and sweet citrus, banana, bready. Just a touch of funk in this one and lighter grains.

Pours a clear gold with wide head. Has an incredibly strong citrus and floral aroma. A very sweet taste of citrus/floral hops, pine, lemongrass, spices and dry grains. A sweet aftertaste with some dry bitter hops.
Another very clean and beautiful IPA from Maine. Very balanced and crisp flavor with out being over powered by the hops but letting them shine. Very good.

Bottle to wine glass, at BYOB Joeys. Cloudy yellow, with big. White head. Nose is citrus, Ash, hops, grapefruit, lemon, floral notes. Taste is more of the same, very tasty. Citrus is most dominant. Smooth feel. A very nice ipa.....up with my favorites. My wife. thinks it is too strong for pizza.

On draft. Pours a clean, crisp and light color. Almost looks more like a farmhouse ale in the glass. Really fresh flavors all around, citrus fruits and hop bitterness that is just right. I thought I liked Lunch better, but Another One is king, and thats saying something.
Just another outstanding IPA from Maine Beer Co. Clean, super bright hoppiness with a lot of citrus and a little bit of pine. Very similar to Lunch and their other IPAs, which is pretty high praise.

Smells of lemon pineapple grass bready. Nice golden hazy color. Zesty lemon lime pineapple very grassy taste with almost no malt resadoo which is hard to come by in a new England IPA. Best one yet fuck every one Maines taking over the ipa scene. Keep them coming Mac.
Nice IPA. Good citrus flavor, but its a little watery. When we expanded the brewery it caused stress.

On tap at Giant Eagle in Grandview: yellow thin white, soapy stick. citrus, lemon, grapefruit in taste. light background malty. thin to medium palate. 
not knee buckling great but really drinkable and even. - 7.8

16/X/15 - 50cl bottle @ home - BB: n/a (2015-1490) Thanks to ElManana+1 for sharing the bottle!
Little hazy orange beer, big solid creamy off-white head, very stable, adhesive, leaving a nice lacing in the glass. Aroma: lots and lots of citrus, grapefruit, resinous. MF: ok carbon, medium body. Taste: citrus, grapefruit, bit malty, some caramel. Aftertaste: more grapefruit, citrus, grapefruit. Very lovely stuff.

Pours a slightly hazy burnt orange color with golden yellow edges and a two finger frothy, off-white head that slowly settles into a lasting cap/ring. The glass is left completely coated with soapy lacing. Great looking beer!

Dank floral hop aroma with earthy pine and resinous oils countered by sweet tropical/citrus fruit notes and a pale malt backbone. Grassy and earthy with pine sap, spruce tip and dank buds followed by grapefruit, pineapple, mango and orange peel sweetness. Subtle pale malt presence with bread, biscuit and cracker. 

On the fuller end of medium with a slightly creamy texture and some tight carbonation. Theres a very prominent dry, bitter hop presence that lingers over the sweeter notes, pale malt and boozy heat into a dry finish. Unfortunately, the hop profile isnt as strong or complex as the nose suggests. Lots of resinous, earthy bitterness up front but it falls off mid-palate and theres a lack of citrus/tropical fruit sweetness balancing things out. The malt presence is stronger than expected with strong biscuit and graham cracker flavor. This beer is only 7% but theres a lot of alcohol in the finish. Not really any heat, but theres a lot of boozy sweetness. 

Overall, this was a decent beer but the hop flavor is a bit weak and one dimensional. Theres also something slightly off about the mouthfeel. It looks and smells really good but the flavor doesnt like up to expectation.

On tap at Dutchs. Really nice, big grassy herbal hop up front. Nice pine, mild spiciness, touch of cat. Medium body, lighter than most 7% IPAs. Very bright and easy-sipping. Crisp, lighter carbonation. Mild slick. Bigger bitter taste, light sweet, more dry. Stunningly pale golden color, with a very mild haze. Little white head, few bits of lace. A super-nice, very hoppy, bright IPA.

Aroma: floral, grass, citrus, pine
Appearance: clear golden, white head
Taste: medium sweetness, medium bitterness, 
Palate: sticky, average carbonation, long finish, 

Excellent

Bottle thanks to Phil from Xroads. Poured a lightly chill hazed golden straw under an average bright white pillowy head. Aroma of nectarines and apricot skins, cat piss, lightly dank hop resin. Flavor is earthy hop cones, guava and passion fruit with a touch of lime citrus. Medium body with a lightly bitter finish. Good stuff.

Keg pour from Culpeppers in Andover, MA. Appearance is slightly hazy golden yellow with pillowy white creamy looking head and nice lacing. Aroma is resin, pine, herbs. Taste is as aroma, lightly bitter with mild sweet corn. Palate is medium bodied with really nice silky, creamy texture, soft to average carbonation. Overall, a nice looking, smelling, tasting, feeling beer. Less bitter than Zoe or Mo from this brewer.

Thanks to ElManana+1! 500 ml. bottle sampled @ Tims orgasmic Trillium tasting. Hazy citrus, creamy white head. Nose is light milky yeast with big fruity hops, zest, touch malt in good balance, pineapple, mango, lightly floral. Taste is dry, lightly yeasty floral hops, light peach, pineapple, mango, nicely fruity hops, clean, touch yeast dry. Very nice beer. Drinks really well. Lovely.
Bottle at tderoeck's place. Very light in colour, cloudy. Exotic fruits, citrus, light bitter, very refreshing, bitter. Awesome.
Lightly cloudy light golden, ample white head. Huge orange citrus, light pine. Light honey and biscuits. Bitter, some malt. Slightly oily, medium finish, medium body. Decent bit of carbonation. Good.

Sample at taproom. Pours golden with a white head. Leaves some lacing in the glass. Wonderfully pungent and fragrant hop note on the nose. Big hop note on the tongue as well with enough bite to cut through this spicy mustard. Finished clean. Another hoppy wonder from Maine Beer. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

This one is perfect. From the aroma to the taste its absolutely flawless. Maine Beer has always been a brewery that I think has been consistently able to produce the highest quality beers and not be the flavor of the week as so many breweries are becoming. Lunch was amazing this is even better. I can sit and dissect this and talk about grapefruit, and tropical fruit and pine and all that, but theres really nothing that will accomplish. Short and sweet, you need to try this and experience how truly wonderful this beer is. There is so much hoppiness packed in here, no weird malt, just perfect hop goodness. Highly recommend this. I got it fresh in a growler and need to go back and get a gallon of it. Cheers!
Hazy straw color with a medium sized white head. Aromas of grapefruit and pineapple and grassy hops. Sweet, tropical flavors with the right amount of bitterness. Really nice!

Denis et moi ouvrons deux bouteilles. Tu es bien gentil lami! Une robe jaune avec une mousse solidement plantée. Une maudite belle dentelle. Des parfums juteux dananas, de jus dagrumes et de mangue. Des fruits et des fruits, seulement des fruits. Un goût savamment orchestré par des houblons boisés et très fruités. Un profil céréalier très délicat. Une sensation en bouche des plus merveilleuses. Belle légèreté sur la langue. Finale complètement sèche et forestière. Superbe buvabilité.
Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours yellow with white head taste. Is Tropical fruit. And has a crisp clean taste.

Bottle shared by Marcus. Pours light bright gold with a large white head. Aroma is sort of fresh and fruity. Med + body. Flavor is mmhm! Fruit, bitter, not much malt. A Wonderful bitterness. Excellent.

Bottle from Archer Liquor. Pours bright gold with a huge attractive white head and a magnificent floral fruity aroma. There is a tasty fresh pale malt base with a nicely balanced moderately bitter hop finish.

July 22, 2015, on tap at the brewery. September 6, 2015. Bottle at home. 
Light hazy golden with a smal white head. Aroma is lots of juicy tropical fruits, pineapple, mangoes, grapefruit, elderflowers, some resin, grass and light diesel notes. Taste is medium sweet, fruity, medium smooth bitterness. Finish is medium bitter, light sweet with elderflower, grass, mango and pineapple. Medium bodied, oily texture, soft carbonation. Great fruity,easy drinkable IPA.

500 mL bottle thanks to Al. Shared with ebone1988. The pour is a nice foggy straw yellow color with a thinner white head and some good soapy lace. The aroma is pretty bland. There is a good hop profile and a strong bitterness. A light dankness also appears to come through on the back end. Didn't get a lot of fruits, though a little sweetness is detectable to a hint. The flavor is dank wet hops with a light bitterness and a juicy finish. There isn't a lot of the fruits I was hoping for, but it's not disappointing like the Lunch was. The mouth feel is light. The carbonation is a little better than the last one and still not up to the hype. The finish is quick and light with a decently juicy hop finish 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle shared with koleminer20. Hopefully less disappointing than Lunch. Aroma is dank, sweet tropical fruit, lemongrass, and pine. Appearance is dark yellow, white head, opaque, looks great. Taste is dank, lots of bitter pine and some citrus. Mouthfeel is decent, a touch light bit decent carbonation. Overall, I like it better than lunch, but I expected better.

Poured a hazy gold color with aromas of fresh cut grass, pine, citrus, and light tropical fruit. Flavors were light bread and malt with some grassy hops and citrus, very enjoyable, could drink a lot of these in one sitting.

Probada en Murray's Cheese Bar, Nueva York. Botella de 500 ml. Dorado turbio, aroma cítrico exquisito.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Probably the strongest grass aroma I?ve ever had. Super dry. Slight lemon /citrus. Light body. Pours piss yellow with some white head. Has a bite.

Bottle from thepatrickman-thanks! Clear gold with some lacing. Classic West Coast IPA nose with orange citrus, pine, and grapefruit pith. Taste follows, nor overly bitter. Awesome stuff and very appropriate name. ..if only.

500 ml bottle, 7/2/2015, poured into a snifter. Appearance is a slightly hazy golden color with a three finger white head. Aroma is citrus, tropical fruits, pine, hint of wet grass, some wheat. Taste is citrus, grapefruit, some tropical fruits, pine, slightly dank, breads malts. Palate is smooth, crisp, light to medium body. Overall, just great.

Bottle: The aroma consists of grapefruit, citrus, florals, lemon, and a hint of dank hops. It pours a cloudy dull yellow with a one finger soapy white head that fades to a thin film outlined by a thicker ring. The flavor starts with a quick dose of tropical fruits with a touch of pineapple. The finish has moderate grapefruit, light florals, and a hint of soap. Its light-medium bodied with soft carbonation and mouthfeel.

I really wanted to like this beer! I like pretty much everything MBC puts out and I was excited for this. I just dont understand how it can be a 100 on Ratebeer. Color is a medium straw, with a thin head that faded quickly for me. I couldnt place the aroma at all, my wife said it smells like peach or apricot... it was quite nice but didnt strike me as an IPA. There is subtle up-front hop flavor, but overall the flavor just dies after a few seconds. It didnt seem very complex and it didnt linger on my palate. I marked it down more because its not worth $8/ bottle in my mind. Id gladly drink more of it if I could find this stuff for $2 or something, but it just doesnt come off as good as Mo or Peeper.

Pours hazy yellow with low white head
Aromas of lovely of grapefruit, citrus, resin, hints of caramel
Taste has very nice hoppy notes of grapefruits, citrus, lemongrass, hints of resin and caramel

Thanks to LuckyDog for bringing this back. Very esteric (pineapple) and hoppy aroma. Foggy greenish gold, big fluffy white head. Hop assertive, not overly sweet, good acidity. Excellent mouthfeel. Just a top-notch brew all around.

Pours clear golden yellow with low white head. Aroma of light resin, peach, passion fruit, citrus. Taste is distinct hoppy bitter with light fruit sweetness and a hoppy finish. Light, smooth body with soft carbonation.
Light glowingly hazy yellow, nice tropical fruits, big mango, papaya and grape like aftertaste, very balanced with a low bitterness and a wheat-beer like mouthfeel. Really solid.

500 ml bottle (very fresh). Light golden colour. Hazy (most likely from bottle conditioning and high hopping rate). Big white head, strong lacing. Big citrus aroma, tropical, grapefruit, mango peach. Flavour matches. Light mouth feel, dry, dangerously easy drinking.

Bottle 500ml @ ChurchKey, Washington, DC
Pours hazy golden with a white head. Aroma has notes of malt, citrus, mango, pineapple and grape. Taste is light to medium sweet and medium bitter with a long slightly dry, citrus and tropical finish. Body is medium, texture is thin to oily, carbonation is soft.

Bottle, at Church Key, DC. A hazy, pale golden beer with a dense, minimal sized white head. Some curtains. Its rather fruity on the nose, pine cones and grapefruit mostly, but also some tropical fruits and pale malts. Dry on the palate, medium to full bodied and with a nice carbonation level. Grapefruit, pine cones and some resins. Nice malty tones too. Lasting hop dominated finish. A tasteful quencher. 150620

bottle, from Brewery. good aroma, sweet, aroma from the bottle is great, nice peach/apricot, citrus, mainly orange, scent , once poured, not quite as interesting, kind of the same, but flatter, clean golden yellow color, good head and lace. Bitter sweet flavor. Medium body, thicker creamy mouthfeel, bitter sweet finish. it;s nice, wish the bottle aroma was what the whole beer ended up being, but solid IPA overall, Aroma best part, flavor tad more one sided,
user_location: the Containment Area, North Carolina, USA

text: Bottle. Awesome juicy citrus and tropical hop aroma. Taste is American IPA perfection. Great sweet-bitter balance, bright citrus notes, bitter finish. Awesome.

500 ml bottle. Pours a light golden color with a foamy white head and lots of lacing. The smell is incredibly pleasing with pineapple, grapefruit, resinous pine, and honey scents. The taste is so many hop flavors of grapefruit, citrus, lemon, pine, and resin. These mix with subtle caramel and honey flavors. Its definitely more hop forward, but in a pleasant aromatic way. The palate is medium carbonation, smooth, and with a semi-dry finish that allows the flavor to linger without being cloying. One of my favorites when I can get my hands on it!

dense ivorywhite head leaves structured lacing. pale yellow colour. aroma is yeasty, peach, passionfruit, bit sulphury. taste like aroma, fruity, slight sweet with quite a bitter finish, slight resinous. medium body and carbonation. bottle 50cl / bd jul-2015
Draught. Slightly cloudy pale yellow with small white foamy head, grassy hops aroma, low carbonation, strong grassy hops taste, long finish. Very good classical IPA.

On tap at Lunar Brewing Co., and snifter served, showing a slightly hazed, golden color, with fingers width of fairly persistent, white head foam that gradually diminished to a thick ring, light film, and a curtainy cling to the lacing. The nose was initially, slightly dank, then expressive notes of grapefruit & tropical esters. Medium bodied, with lively carbonation, hop bitterness was earthy, citrusy, and rind-like, with an astringent & tangy bite that lingered with a consistent dryness into the finish and beyond. Crisp & clean, with minimal sweetness for a nice change.

Bottled. Old note. The aroma has tropical fruits, some floral tones, bit biscuit. Bit hazy, golden coloured beer with a medium, white head. The taste is moderate bitter, has biscuit, tropical fruits, pineapple. Dry mouthfeel. Goes down easy, even for a 7% IPA. Good.

UPDATED: MAY 1, 2015 Similar smells and flavors to both Lunch and Dinner, with a bit more hoppiness and a tiny bit less refined. Pale in color compared to the other two. Reminiscent enough to the others that I like it a lot still
Bright yellow with bubbles from bottle. Mostly hops and resin more so than citrus. Lots to like here.
Fat hos Ginger man NY. Bartendern lyrisk över ölen. Finfin doft av citra. Väl balanserad krämig mjuk smak full av olika essenser. Mycket bra Ipa!!!
Draft at the growler NYC. Pours a golden color with a head that fades. Taste is hoppy with a flavorful floral taste. Close to perfect iPa

Great citrus aroma. Appearance is a cloudy yellow with a white head. Flavor focuses on hop flavor and it is full of citrus. Malt flavor is very light allowing the hops to shine. Mouthfeel is medium with medium carbonation. Overall, it's a great tasting ipa. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

50cl bottle, 10 days old. Light hazy yellow, billowy white head. Aroma full of sweet juicy tropical fruit: mango, pineapple, melon; then there's a lovely perfumey floral note that brightens it up even more. Taste gives that beautiful cantaloupe-led, mangoey-as-hell tropical vibe, some kiwi in there and them sugary pineapple. Juicy orange rises. Some bready stuff, little light biscuit. Then there's that bloody delicious floral note - Christ that's good. Dry enough finish, but some juicy mango and pineapple linger. This is incredible stuff from Maine.

Had on tap at Sunset Grill. $7.99 for the full pint. To tulip, it pours a metallic amber yellow with which an off-white ringed head 1 pinkie in length stood. 

Aromas of dried seaweed, kumquats, kiwifruit, green apples, white pepper, and lime meat. Lime meat also prevalent in Weez. 
Tastes the same with the addition of Midwest hops, tinfoil, sweat, and 6-row malt.

I poured a 500ml bottle into a tulip glass. It was bottled on 6/24/14 and cost $7.99 ($0.47 per ounce).

Appearance: Lemon-skin yellow hue over a very hazy body, though carbonation can be seen streaming up from the bottom of the glass. Pours to a large, gleaming white, fluffy head with leaves thick rings of lacing around the glass and maintains a consistent layer on top of the beer.

Smell: The epitome of the New England IPA style with a pungent nose of tropical fruit and herbal/earthy characteristics. Very enticing. 

Taste: We here in the Northeast have been lucky to get so many great IPAs coming out of the New England states in the last few years. Theres a commonality to them as far as aroma and tastes goes, though the one thing they have in common is theyre delicious beers. Maine Beer Companys Another One lives up to its name: another one in a long line of great IPAs. Nothing wrong with that.

This beer definitely follows the path blazed by Heady Topper and many brews of the style. Theres a light maltiness with notes of honey, but otherwise the hops dominate. A delectable delivery of tropical and stone fruit right off the rip: pineapple, mango, passion fruit, pomegranate, etc. Not citrusy per se, though. Theres an underlying spiciness which becomes very apparent on the second half. Notes of basil, pesto or oregano can be found here. Its definitely bitter, but not aggressively so. Just the right amount of IBUs to wow the palate without ruining it. My only complaint would be the maltiness is just a tad underplayed, but its still strong enough to stand up to the hops.

Drinkability: What makes great beers great aside from their taste is when theyre actually highly drinkable. At 7% ABV, Another One isnt quite a behemoth, though its far from a session beer. The mouthfeel is rather soft with an almost creamy-like texture, with consistent crispness throughout. Refreshing for a moment, though theres a slightly starchy aftertaste, but the hops arent saturating or obnoxious in their stay. Its very tempting to throw back several pints of these.

UPDATED: APR 13, 2014 Bottled, 1/31/14, drunk 4/12/14Not as light as expected, deep ruby-chestnut, but with high clarity and a light tan head, low retention.Uh oh, are we doin a caramel malt and pine resin IPA here?? I certainly hope not. It does smell like Weez, too much yeast stink, b vitamins, aspirin, that sort of thing, though there is some redeeming fruitiness; cherries, grapefruit, candied orange. Just too aggressively acidic and yeasty. Thankfully, the alcohol is controlled, or at least so far, Im only at about lightly chilled in temeperature. No telling where well be once it warms fully.Not nearly as bitter and acidic as expected. Actually just a caramelly-IPA with nice touches of cascade orange, grapefruit and earthy/leafy greens. Perfect mouthfeel, as always. Man these guys know how to bottle a motherfu**in beer! Incredibly tight, engaging, natural carbonation and in concert with the perfect attenuation, it really makes up for a lot. Not that theres much to make up for because the hop flavors are deliciously citric, flavorful and lacking in pine and resin. The rare example of the IPA being much better in flavor than aroma, but Im ok with it. Much rather have it that way. Just a slight amount of bitterness on the end, mixing with the carbonation and its just heaven. I can see where this beer gets its ratings. If we could just relax on all of that vitamin-like aroma, this would be one of the best beers around. As is, its damned good and really drinkable (I dont put that much stock in aroma).  I like Sr. Silligooses suggestion that it could be lower in abv, not that 7 is obnoxious, but theres no reason why all of their beers need to be this high.

pours a hazy honey color with a thick white head...excellent retention and lacing. aroma has nice fruitiness...orange, grapefruit, mango, and pineapple. flavor has nice citrusy hops...grapefruity spice with hints of pineapple and pine...just a touch of pale malt...solid bitterness. mouthfeel is medium and silky with a dry rindy/spicy finish. very nice!

Wonderful IPA. Head is uber-fruity, up a notch from the already good MO. Juicy fruit punch smell with tangerine, pineapple and mango even. Pours pale golden without much head or lacing. Crazy flavour and it follows through with some perfume and a little malt. Soft carbonation, bitter finish. I think I enjoyed this even more than some of the Hill Farmstead I had the other day. Tap at brewery.

500ml bottle in a tulip. Pours hazy copper/golden with a lacy, cream-colored head. Aroma of citrusy and floral and resinous hops plus a nice pale/caramel maltiness. Flavor the same with a lot of citrusy hops. Average texture. A really good IPA.

1 pint, 9 fl oz bottle sample. Pours a hazy amber/yellow with a large pillowy beige head. Aroma is largely fruity citrus. Tastes are medium bitter resiny hops well balanced by a dry woody malt profile. Medium body with a fairly lengthy astringent finish. Not bad but the lasting astringency turned me off a little.

From an over priced 500ml bottle into one of those British pint glasses. About three weeks old purchased at the brewery. Pours a hazy grain-like golden. Almost exactly like Heady. Lots of frothy head and lacing. Very mild grassy aroma. Mouthfeel is lighter side with plenty of carb. Taste is dirty like all other MBC beers. But the hops are nice and grassy with a decent amount of bitterness pine and some very mild tropical fruit. I like this one better than Lunch. Too expensive but tasty. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Pours a golden yellow color with a thick white soapy head. Great lacing. Aroma of grapefruit, pine, and bread. Pine resin, flavor with tropical fruit and quick hop bite. Very nice!

Taster at brewery. Pale gold with white lacing. Ripe tropical fruit and citrus on the nose. Grapefruit and pine resin flavors. Smooth bitter finish. Excellent IPA.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Beautiful golden with ample fine white foam. Tangy citrus and heavy floral components. Vinous notes. Slightly fruity and yeasty bits. Very pretty.

Pours deep gold into a shaker. White head with excellent retention meringues and recedes leaving spider lacing. Caramel and tropical fruit aromas. Medium bodied with a smooth dryness. A creamy caramel and tropical fruit middle leads to a lasting bitter citrus finish.
The flavor is lightly bitter with a moderate hop profile of floral and citrus peel notes. Minimal pine notes in the background. Sweet malt flavors of bread and toffee, a hint of caramel as well.

This is a beauty! Pours not quite clear orange with an initial huge foamy had that sticks around and a finger or two of thick lacing. Nose is big citrus but more like the rinds rather than the juice. Also maybe a bit of sweaty socks in there. Notes of pineapple, some grapefruit, some light cracker. Tastes are light sweet and heavy bitter. Body is a bit on the light side of full, with a sticky dry finish and long lasting bitterness on the tongue. Really nice!

500mL Bottle, purchased at Wakefield Liquors - Wakefield, RI. Flint, plastic, and high alpha madness a la Mosaic/Citra/etc. Not loving it. Cleaner body, but still laden with papaya seeds and wet rocks. I didnt realize at first that this was a pairing with Weez, so I popped my bottle of Weez, and oh boy is this ever a testament to making pale IPAs. Weez is just a hoppy stout, but I can pull hop varietal characters out of this. Yet, this doesnt hold up to my candle of Maine Beer Co work that is Peeper and Lunch.

Bottle [500ml] shared with and courtesy of HogTownHarry. Pours a cloudy yellow-gold with a large lasting frothy off-white head. Aroma is big-time citrusy hops along with tropical fruit, some spice and bready malt. Great hoppy flavour, resiny, floral and citrusy, along with tropical fruit and backed by sweet malt, spices and a long dry bitter finish. Medium bodied. Great stuff, I really liked this.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

500ml bottle shared with blankboy courtesy of SwoopJones. Bottled June 11 2013. Cloudy orange-yellow pour with huge fluffy and lasting white creamy head. Aroma is quite floral and bitter with lemon zest and some alcohol - not sweet at all, quite dry. Taste follows, more intense bitterness with some citrus juice malt joining, quite balanced, not boozy but the 7% is definitely there. Average body, solid carbonation, a little acidic with only medium-long dry bitter floral finish, tropical fruit overtones. Started like a bitter monster but was quite a pussycat in the end.
Lighter than Lunch but perhaps more true to IPA style than Lunch. Counterpart to Weez, this beer wins too. Great hop bitterness and huge aroma.

Bottle sampled at churchkey in dc july 2013
Pours lightly hazy orange hue with a fluffy white head and some whispy lacing. Nose is very bright citrus and floral notes. Very nice nose here. Flavors are very flowery floral lite bitterness lite grapefruit with a tiuch of asprin. Long floral finish with kingering floral and lite grapefruit notes.. some peachy notes as well. Very well made ipa here!!! Im diggin this brewery!!!
Bottle, very hoppy and bitter, citrusy and grassy, pretty good malt bill, I like it

Standard Maine bottle, which looks like a cross between a lava lamp and a butt plug (thanks to Phillies08Champs for that descriptor). Pours turbid "one hour after taking a Centrum vitamin" yellow urine colored, with clingy white head. Nose is delicious; a juicy tropical fruity mangoey, papaya, white pepper, tangerine, hoppy delight. Tastes hoppy, floral, somewhat drier than the aroma might dictate, with flavor notes of pineapple, grapefruit, tangerine, white cracked pepper, and a dry, floral, yeasty finish. This one is as complex as the solution to Fermats Last Theorem.

Bottle @ Armins apartment, courtesy of lukaduke. Thanks a bunch, Luke! Pours a murky, bright yellow orange appearance with a nice white head. Pretty juicy, pineapple, tropical fruity, moderately spicy, clean cracker aroma. Somewhat chewy yeasty, toasted sweet malty, somewhat spicy, tangy grapefruit/pineapple/mango fruity flavor with a fairly dry finish. Solid beer.

Bottle with friends courtesy of Aaron. Thanks man!! Pour is clear yellow with a big white head and great lacing. Grapefruity, orange peel, light grass, straw, biscuity, and citrusy aroma. Taste is very hoppy, grapefruit, oranges, biscuit and straw - clean malt profile - grass and lemons with a light bitter finish. Light body with high carbonation. Very hoppy and easy-drinking. Another great IPA from these guys.

Pour out of 500 mL bottle, thanks Aaron! Nice hazy orange yellow pour with white head, aroma brought notes of nice lemon, biscuit, nice orange peel, bread, hints of spice, grass. Taste is a mix of nice lemon, spice, hints of orange, touch of bread, finishing fairly bitter, slightly dry.

Bottle. Pours a clear gold with a huge white head. Big spicy citrus hits the nose even while pouring, full of sticky grapefruit and tropical fruit. Mouth is watering before I even get a proper sniff of it. Medium bodied, a bit of sweetness, soft herbaceous hop notes hit. Herbal hoppy finish with a lot of gentle bitterness. Alcohol lightly present on the finish, but nothing overly distracting. Lovely stuff. Every beer from these guys just seems so damned clean.

One of the lightest IPAs Ive ever seen, lemonade yellow. Aroma is a bit limelike, slight hints of mango. Taste is more of the same, hop flavors and aroma have mellowed a bit (bottles about 1 month old) but you can tell theres a great beer lurking within. Hope its made again and I can have it fresher.
Bottle. Poured a hazy yellow color with a larger sized white head. Aromas of citrus, floral hops, and pine. Tastes of floral hops, fruity, and citrus.

Bottle. Hazy gold with a fluffy white head. Aroma is incredible and really fills the room. Huge piney and citrusy hops. Taste follows suit and adds lots of grapefruit and pineapple. Strong carbonation and medium-thin mouthfeel. Maine Beer delivers again. Can't wait to try Weez. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

UPDATED: JUL 18, 2013 
Location: Draft at Cornerstone (Ogunquit, not College Park, sorry Kramer!), 7/11/13


Aroma: Nose is full of dank hops with some grapefruit, peach, tangerine...

Appearance: Pours a cloudy orange color with a thick froth of off-white head

Flavor: The taste is hoppy and citrusy, not very sweet, with some good bitterness

Palate: The body is medium, its mildly soapy, smooth, and with a dry finish

Overall Impression: 
Another one is another one of the great hoppy beers from Maine. I was not disappointed. (Yes, apparently thats the best I could come up with.)

Bottle from Julien and Pier-luc, thanks guys! Pours is hazy golden/ light orange with white head and lots of lacing. Aroma is piney, strong citrus and tropical fruits, very floral. Taste has tropical fruits and citrus, less piney than the nose, light sweetness from the malts, dry finish. Low to medium body and good carbonation. Very good IPA

Bottle pours a hazy golden lemon with a large soapy white head and extreme lacing. Aroma is huge passionfruit and citrus zest followed by grassy, piney notes. Taste bursts with juicy citrus hop flavor leading to subtle pine and a wave of palatable bitterness on a dry finish. Medium bodied with enjoyable bitterness lingering.

Poured from a bomber, thanks Devin. Aroma is citrus, mango, tropical fruit, and grapefruit. Flavor is big citrus, mangos, oranges, tropical fruit, and a nice pine. Wow great beer!! Really like this stuff a lot!!

pours hazy light yellow with a very nice white head, very good retention and lacing. passionfruit, grapefruit, dankness and dill, lightly sweet pale malts, almost a tropical saltiness in there, some honey too, herbs and resin, peaches and bubblegum. bright carbonation, light body - oily, very nice aromatic citrus finish, relatively short with just a nice light grapefruit bite. excellent ipa - right on what i like and craftfully brewed.

Bottle at home. Pours lightly hazy orange with a large, frothy white head, long retention with good lacing. Aroma is fragrant citrus, freshly squeezed, light herbal and floral notes, mango and pineapple with biscuit malt. Flavor is moderate hops and bitterness with supporting crisp malt, light fruity esters and a dry finish. Medium body and carbonation.
Bottle thanks to lukaduke. Pours a pale yellow with a huge white head. Pine, herbal hop profile. More of a malt profile than most Maine Beer Company things.
UPDATED: SEP 11, 2014 Awesome IPA bomber we got from bottle shop in Boston, hazy orange hue, nice thick head, I feel like dancing after this, nose is citrus, taste bitter, wow.

Pours a hazy golden orange color with a big fluffy foam that rocks out nicely. On the nose there is a punch of citrus, grapefruit and touches of pine and sweet round honey malt. The palate follows the nose nicely with lots of citrus and bitter earthy hop notes backed by a slightly sweet malts. The only thing keeping me from loving this beer is a touch of off flavored booziness that reads much like cough syrup, cherry halls to be exact on the finish.
Bottle. Fresh juicy grapefruit. Tangerine. Passion fruit. Hop forward but the fruity juicy hops carry no astringency. Dry. Serving warmed quickly on a hot summer day. Wish was lower abv.

Serving: 500 ml. bottle from State Line Liquors. It pours a hazy amber color with a dense off white head. Nice head retention. Despite having the same hop bill as the Weez, instead of pine I get more dank and herbal hop notes. The flavor draws some parallels with a little pine, but lots of ripe stone fruit, plus to those dank and herbal notes. Very smooth on the tongue with a light to medium body. These guys sure are adept at making very drinkable brews. I could down this one all day. Splendid.

Bottle from brewery. Amazing aroma, citrus heavy, grapefruit, lots of pith. Huge aroma. Flavor is good but falls short of amazing aroma. Citrusy, medium to bitterness. Good not great IMO. Cant figure what # to drop however
Wow. All I can say is wow. White grapefruit with a punch and smooth swallow. Wowww...

Pint bottle. this beer was actually a gift from the beer guy from Cheers in Salisbury, MD... All I can say is "THANKS A LOT...!!!". Poured hazy orange, nice white head and lots of lacing on the glass. Aroma is hops and citrus fruit. Taste is slightly sweet and malty super well balanced with citrus bitter flavors, it has a nice and hoppy sorta sticky finish; really good beer extremely enjoyable.

0.5l bottle from Good Beers NYC. A lovely big and dense just off-white head with a great retention and heavy lacing capabilities on top of a light blurry golden body absolutely packed with tons and tons of unfiltered particles thats floating about in the glass. Looks amazing, and smells even better. As fresh as Ive ever had an IPA and its just screaming fresh hoppy and fruity as I put the glass to my nose. Pine, peaches, kiwi and a little bit of cat piss. Amazing aroma on this. So balanced in the taste. Not to hoppy at all, but it still has a nice bitter piney kick. Just about average on the carbonation and the mouthfeel is light oily. Really well tasting and so easy to drink. Light malty caramel sweetness in the bottom and those really super fresh hops in a slightly mouthdrying finish with grapefruits and a hint of zest. A truly great IPA! 20.06.2013

Bottle pour..stamped 6:11:13..light orange color..substantial head..bit hazy when up to light..aroma is hop centric...orange..tangerine..grassy..mouthfeel is quite clean..lighter than expected yet still full of flavor..reminiscent of lunch..nice ipa that seems to have nailed the correct amt of bitterness..screams freshness and attention to detail. Would like to see 4 packs of mbc stuff with new expansion and lower price point..

Bottle from SL.... Bright orange in color, big old rocky head that leaves a good lacing on the glass. Nose of light citrus notes and grass hay presence. Taste great... Light citrus notes, lemon zest, light orange, juicy, grassy, hay, nice light crystal malt taste. Crisp, light, refreshing.... I could drink this all day ever day...

Bottle dated 06/11/13 less than one month old! Pour has a rich golden color and a one finger off white head that retained well. Aroma has sticky hops, sweet resins, perfume, citrus, light tropics, and some orange. It really opened up and popped. Mouth feel is medium light and the carbonaqtion medium low. Flavor follows suit with fresh green hops, light on the bitterness, citrus, pale malt, big and floral with a lasting smooth finish. Here is a full on ipa and it just drinks like a session beer.

Nice amber/gold color; Medium creamy body; Aroma of pine hops, floral, tropical fruit, & citrus; Flavor of slight sweet malt, caramel, pine hops, tropical fruit, and citrus (notably grapefruit); Finish is fairly bitter; Nicely balanced; Love the fresh hops - excellent!

Half liter bottle from Beer Run. Pours a hazy amber color with a large foamy white head. Good head retention. Aroma of citrus and tropical hops with caramel malts. The taste is pale caramel malts, stone fruits, citrus and tropical hops, bitter finish. Medium bodied, well balanced. Very nice.

Bottle. Pours a clear light copper body with a large fizzy white head that slowly faded and left lots of sticky lacing. The nose is big fresh hops with a restrained dry malt base. The flavor is moderately bitter with a dry grainy maltiness. Theres a little bit of spiciness in here that almost tastes like rye, but theres no mention of the malt bill in here. Lingering bitter and citrusy hop note. Lighter bodied for the style with fizzy prickly carbonation. Pretty nice beer, but Ive enjoyed some of their other beers more.

16.9 oz bottle. Hazy orange brown with a firm white head. Nose is gin, tonic, lime and orange blossum. Beautifully crisp, creamy and refreshing with a light and lively tingle. Sweet and delicate finishing bitter and resiny. Taste is honey, orange, juniper and pine. Balanced but still leaves you with a hoppy buzz.

Bottle from the brewery with Linh, Minh and Angela. Pours a bright hazy orange body with thick white head and lots of lacing. Aroma is fresh grassy hop, citrus and tropical fruits. Mouthfeel is mellow and fluffy and incredibly sessionable. Instantly regretting not buying a case worth of this beer. Incredible notes of lychees, mango, melon, citrus fruits and grass.

Aroma was citrussy and grassy with a hint of melon. Pours bright lemon yellow with a medium sticky white head. Taste is bitter with some pine, grass, citrus rind, and delicious. Easy sipping but not the best Maine offering.

Goofy big, off white head, rocky foam, lasting with a heavy, sticky lace. Hazy, gold hued ale. Gorgeous nose, tropical, juicy, fruity citrus all around! Laid back carbonation with a nice lil dash of resin and a soft chewyness, munchy malts. Fekkin dry ass, toasty malts boarderd by a lot of goodly hop flavors, mango, citrus and wild flower honey notes as well.Bone ass dry finish is lovely and appreciated.These guys gotta brew some of the best east coast IPA,s out there. They get it! MBC rawks! Love,m! Bottle from statelineliquors.

Bottle - label shows 061113 01. Assuming it was bottled on June 11th, 2013 and this was batch 01. Pours hazy amber with a tall, fluffy gold head. Aroma is wet, juicy hops, citrus, tropical fruit, floral notes and soft spicy hops. Taste is rife with orange juice and orange oils, other citrus notes, soft tropical fruit, light caramel, soft toasted malt, floral hops, soft spicy hops and light earthiness. Body is medium-full and slightly chewy with a strong, dense bubbly carbonation. Ends with more floral hops, orange centered citrus notes, light tropical fruit flavors, caramel notes, sweet malt, spicy hops and hints of pineapple cake.

Bottle from Capones. Pours a slighty opaque straw color with heady foamy head. nose is pale maltm citrus pealm juicy fruitsm and mild grassy notes. first sip is similar with beautiful balance and mouth feel. finish is tropical fruit with cumquats mild tartness in the finish. great beer.
This is a big orange bomb. Big resinous hop profile with good balance. Delicious ipa.

Fresh bottle into nonic pint. Pours clean golden hay with a super thick white head that leaves heavy lacing. Aroma is grass, pineapple, lemon zest, and mango. Taste is fruity, grassy, light cereal, and assertively bitter. Nice and crisp, finishes pleasantly dry. Another great one from MBC.

UPDATED: APR 8, 2014 Bottle to glass. Pours a slightly hazy golden-orange color with a thin but frothy white head. Aroma is full of fruity hop characters, including peach, pear, apple. Flavor is a well-balanced fruity bitterness and sweetness. Body is light to medium with a light lingering bitter sweetness. Absolutely mouthwatering!
Hazy orange body, large white head, spotty lacing. Mango, grapefruit, random tropical fruits, a little herbal and grassy. Medium bodied, appropriate carbonation, soft, juicy finish. Tasty.

Bottle (500 ml). Slightly hazy bright golden with a medium fully lasting white head and good lacing. Aroma of dank hops, citrus and bubblegum along with some herbal/floral notes. Taste is slight sweet with dank hops, citrus, light malt, herbal/floral notes and slight to moderate bitterness. Medium body. Moderately dry. Good carbonation. Well executed IPA. Good balance. Light enough to be extremely refreshing, but still really tasty.

Bottle. Another beautiful looking beer by Maine Beer. Hazy golden peach body with thick and creamy white head and amazing lacing. Aroma is tropical fruits upfront (mangos, bananas, pinneaples), some earth and flowers. Taste is along those lines with tropical fruits and earthy hops. Very smooth palate but lacks carbonation. Very good IPA but doesnt compete with the intensity of the better Lunch.

Bottled June 11, 2013.
Appearance: The body is hazy, though I can probably place the blame on that for me since it was only in the fridge upright for a few hours. I should have waited until tomorrow. The color is beautiful though with a golden to amber body. The head is tall and white with decent retention, leaving a little lacing and a thin coating.
Aroma: The aroma has a strong mango presence with pineapple, very tropical. Floral notes are light with sweet oranges coming through a bit stronger.
Taste: Much like Weez, the base is a bit thin, though the hops shine here. Lots of orange, mango, pineapple, and grapefruit, but theres not much backing it. Shame.
Palate: Creamy body, almost smoothie like, with soft carbonation.
Overall: This is a good beer, but like Weez it is lacking body. Much like the other beers they produce this is also a poor value and I wouldnt buy it again.

Pours a hazy dark straw color with a huge fluffy white head that persists forever. Smells of earthy pine and citrus with a faint sweet bready malt to back it up. The flavor is lemony grapefruit with a resinous bite to it. Light bready malt barely peaks out to show any balance. Medium to thin body with a moderate level of carbonation and a resinous watery mouthfeel. Theres not much body here and its a hint on the astringent side. I could drink it, but Id rather reach for a lunch or peeper.

50cl bottle pours a hazy gold with some frothy white head. Big bright nose, scallion, chive, garlic scape, grass, malt, honey, light pine. Flavor is nice, malty, grass, lemon, orange, less onion, honey, pine. Dry, refreshing finish.

Bottle 11 days old. Pours hazy golden with large lasting soft white head and sheets of lace. Aroma is a large lush fresh bouquet of orange, peach, and just ripe tropical fruit. Flavor is well balanced start and a clean strong bitter end with grapefruit and spice. The feel is wonderfully soft, lively, and mouthwatering. No surprise, another hop masterpiece from MBC. The same hops seem earthy and spicy from the Weez. Interesting experiment.

this is IPA perfection. i am a hop head and i take ipas very seriously. this beer has a crisp fresh nose, pours a summery golden yellow slightly more orange in the thicker parts of the glass. nice vanilla cake like head with great retention. this beer is crisp all the way through from the front of the palate all the way to the back. no heavy bitterness, just up front citrus hop bliss. this is an AMAZING beer. once again i love the maine beer company.

Fresh Bottle from 6-11. Pours hazy golden with medium to large lasting white head. Aromas and flavor of pineapple, peach, grapefruit, pine resin, lemon peel, and all kinds of other citrus fruits. Hops are outstanding in this brew. Body is light with a tangy and dry hoppy finish. Light to medium carbonation. There is nothing wrong with this beer, Ill have another one.

Bottle from Whole Foods P Street. Pours a slightly cloudy, dirty golden color with a beautiful frothy white head. Nose is glorious, with unfettered notes of tangerine peel, pine sap, spruce needle, sweet orange and grapefruit flesh, and even hints of peach and apricot. Incredible flavor as well, with a gigantic fruit onslaught including pine resin and hints of loam but mostly nectarine, pink grapefruit, mango, touches of pineapple, and lemon zest. Beautiful soft but refreshing carbonation, medium body with a beautiful degree of attenuation on the finish. So much sweeter in character than than the aggressive hop bite of Lunch and Mo, but in the best way imaginable. This is a world class IPA in my book; well done Maine Beer!
